intro: Pilosella vahlii, commonly known as the Vahl's pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage covered in fine, white hairs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and it is known for its long-lasting, fluffy seed heads. Pilosella vahlii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive, drought-resistant features.
